overview: From 2025-07-28 to 2025-07-29, ethereum-optimism/op-geth had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add `minBaseFee` to the block header's `extraData` field
topIssues.author: geoknee

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add an extra `uint64` for `minBaseFee` in `PayloadAttributesV3`
topIssues.author: geoknee

topPRs.title: all: Merge go-ethereum v1.16.1
topPRs.author: sebastianst
topPRs.body:
**Description**

This is a replacement of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/638 with a clean git history (preserving upstream commits, squashing all merge-related changes into the merge commit)

Credit fully goes to @0x00101010 for the actual upstream merge work.

For reference and [jj](https://github.com/jj-vcs/jj) shilling, this PR was created with:
```
jj new v1.16.1 optimism -m "Merge go-ethereum v1.16.1 (#638)"
jj restore -f 64bc7e5e
jj describe --author "Francis Li <francis.li@coinbase.com>"
```
this leads locally to a _change_ `osn`, which can repeatedly be rebased using
```
jj rebase -s osn -d v1.16.1 -d optimism
```

topPRs.title: feat: introduce configurable minimum base fee
topPRs.author: wlawt
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

From: https://github.com/wlawt/op-geth/pull/20 

**Description**

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

This PR adds a [configurable minimum base fee](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/blob/main/protocol/minimum-base-fee.md) to op-geth. Specifically, this extends the `extraData` section in the block header to include an extra u64 for this addition. The default value would be zero, as if there was no minimum base fee to begin with if the configurable minimum base fee wasn't enabled. 

This PR also adopts the new feature flag oriented approach in terms of the naming conventions. 


**Tests**

<!--
Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.
-->

- Extended tests to include Jovian and the new minBaseFee fee
- Added tests to ensure CalcBaseFee is still correct
- Added activation test
- Went through the repo for mentions of Holocene or EIP1559Params to check for more tests to add, but didn't find any that I think would be impacted


**Additional context**

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

Introducing a minimum base fee reduces the chances of experiencing priority fee auctions which occur when the block is almost at the gas limit, as well as cases where batcher sequencer throttling is happening where it intentionally processes fewer transactions to avoid a backlog of batches.

**Metadata**

<!-- 
Include a link to any github issues that this may close in the following form:
- Fixes #[Link to Issue]
-->

N/A

topContributors.summary: wlawt: Focused on introducing a configurable minimum base fee, evidenced by two open PRs: ethereum-optimism/op-geth#648 and ethereum-optimism/optimism#16852.

sebastianst: Focused on a significant update to `op-geth`, merging PR #652 which incorporated `go-ethereum v1.16.1` with substantial changes (+8448/-2386 lines), demonstrating a focus on core system maintenance and upgrades.

AmadiMichael: Focused on addressing a bug related to superchain configuration upgrades, reflected in their open PR ethereum-optimism/optimism#16838, which involved modifying 2 files with a primary focus on bugfix work. Their contributions today primarily involved work on tests and configuration files.

geoknee: Focused on the foundational work for a new "min-base-fee" feature, creating multiple issues to track its implementation across different repositories, including ethereum-optimism/op-geth#650, ethereum-optimism/op-geth#649, and ethereum-optimism/optimism#16839, and closing the specification issue ethereum-optimism/specs#742.

yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on proactive system health monitoring by creating two issues in ethereum-optimism/optimism, specifically to alert on low peer count health for flashblocks-enabled sequencers (#16868) and to flag when non-flashblocks-enabled sequencers are active or flashblocks are enabled (#16867).
mslipper: Focused on release management, creating a new issue (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16843) to track the rollout and release of the op-batcher.
